description: This ham powder will give a special touch to the flavor of our risotto.
items: On a flat plate, arrange the slices of Serrano ham separately. Put it in the microwave at 500 W in 3-4 batches of 1 minute. Until the ham is crispy.
Chop the slices very small using a knife so that they remain of a powder.
Start by chopping and browning the garlic with a little oil. Set all the cooking in the same low pot or high frying pan.
Add the onion cut into very small cubes (brunoise) and let it simmer over low heat.
Cut the mushrooms into quarters and sheets. Add the cut mushrooms to the pot, season with salt and pepper and allow the mixture to cook over low heat.
Take the opportunity to put the broth in a pot, since when you add it to the rice, it has to be hot.
Continue adding the rice in the pot with the garlic, onion and mushrooms already well preserved.
When the rice is already hot, add the wine and let it evaporate.
At this time add the broth, enough to cover the rice and a little more.
Keep adding hot broth as the rice is dry, testing the grain. Be sure to have the rice with little broth when it is ready.
Also rectifying salt and pepper almost at the end of cooking, _keep in mind that you will add Parmesan that has a salty touch_.
_The cooking time will depend a lot on the type of rice and the moderation of the fire, generally it will take about 15-20 min_.
When having the cooked and almost dry (syrupy) rice, remove it from the heat. It is time to add the butter in small cubes and the grated Parmesan, stirring gently.
It will be ready when all the butter is melted, leading to a mellow and shiny appearance.
Finally, add the ham powder and also put a little when it is already plated.
